title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
Here students are asked to discuss the background of the Russian revolutions from a standpoint other than politics â€” the aspect most likely familiar to them. In fact, a majority of students wrote mainly about the political background. Such discussion was not deemed to be a problem if social and economic factors also received attention, but where it replaced response to the terms of the question, students could earn at most a score in the range 4-5.

8-9 points:

Focuses clearly on the question: describes and analyzes social and economic changes and their ties to revolution; May supplement this discussion with political content; Offers strong supporting details; Contains no major factual errors.

6-7 points:

Focuses on the question, both economic and social changes, perhaps with some unevenness; May include much political content; Tries to show causal relationship of changes to revolution; Provides some specific support for assertions; May include some factual errors.

4-5 points:

Directly responds to the question, perhaps quite unevenly; Probably emphasizes political events; Provides some support for generalizations; Likely includes errors of fact, perhaps a major error.

2-3 points:

Does not focus on the question asked, perhaps offering an entirely political discussion; Fails to support general statements adequately; Includes a number of significant factual errors.

1 point:

Contains little or no relevant information; Includes extensive errors.

0 points:

Does not meet the criteria for earning 1 point or more.
